The World Innovation Summit for Education (WISE) has begun its global search for outstanding young learners (aged 18 to 25) from diverse backgrounds and disciplines for the 2015-16 Learners’ Voice Program. Until 30 April 2015, WISE is accepting nominations and applications for the new cohort that will be joining our global Learners’ Voice community.

The Program focuses on building their knowledge of education and social entrepreneurship, as well as their leadership and communication skills.

WHO CAN BE NOMINATED OR APPLY? Young people aged 18-25 who are active in their communities and can demonstrate a strong passion for, and commitment to, education. Individuals can be nominated by representatives of institutions, organizations, programs and networks from around the world or can apply personally by submitting an application form endorsed by two referees. A full set of eligibility criteria is outlined on the application page.

THE PROCESS: Nominations and applications can be completed online.Create an account and complete the official form available on the WISE online application system: http://www.wise-qatar.org/learners-voice-6

WHEN? Entries must be submitted before 30 April 2015, 18:00 GMT

For further information about the WISE Learners’ Voice Program please follow our activities on Twitter (#WISELearners), visit the WISE website (http://www.wise-qatar.org/), the Learners’ Voice blog, or contact the WISE Team at learnersvoice@wise.org.qa
